## DELIVERABLE 1   
*Analysis of the technological diversification potential of the 4 parts of the country (including the provinces), using the OECD REGPAT dataset of patents 2018-2021. This is done for the priorities mentioned in each RIS, as well as for all technologies (3 digit). It is examined to what extent there has been an improvement/deterioration compared to the previous period 2015-2018*

Note from PA:  
- This deliverable includes treemaps and smart specialization graphs (rel/comp) from patent data (RegPat).    
- Tech level: in our first analysis we did at the 2-digit level (wipo classification) + priority level; and for this new analysis we said we would do 3-digit. I did 4 levels: prio, wipo, 3-digit and 4-digit.  
- Geo level: nuts1 and nuts2, as for the first analysis.   
- Time: 2018-2021 (included, so 2018,19,20 and 21) and 2015-2018 (included, so 2015,16,17 and 18). Please note that the new 2015-18 is obviously qualitatively similar to the analyses we provided the first time (I checked, but please let me know if you see something strange) BUT it is not exactly the same because (1) last time we used a much earlier edition of RegPat (huge right truncation as you know because of delays in patent publication, so we had for instance very litlle 2017 patents and almost no 2018), (2) tech re-classification at the patent office, (3) last time we did 2014-18 (not 15-18), (4) because we did not do the projects for north, east, west and south at the same time we used #versions of regpat. So for consistency and time comparisons please use the 2015-18 version provided here.  
- For your dynamic analysis (improvement/deterioration) I would suggest to focus on wether a region increased or decreased its RTA in complex tech or not. This is the key (and cleanest) indicator of improvement. Improvement in number of patents and relatedness can also be interesting. You will see that there are some great stories to tell!!
